issue_description:
# [Bug]: Remove extraneous whitespace below translation review language selector

There's a lot of extra whitespace below the language selector:

![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9004726/225400348-0bb6db00-0eca-4a19-815d-5f324a066d13.png)

For new contributors, you'll want to look at the elements in core/templates/pages/contributor-dashboard-page/contributions-and-review/contributions-and-review.component.html. See https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributor-dashboard to get started.

issue_comments.body: @jahd2602 Do you mind taking a look at this?

hello @sagangwee I would love to work on this issue plz assign this to me 
I think the issue can be solve by changing margin/padding properties using CSS
or
using the position properties of the elements

by the way I am new and this will be my first contribution can u please tell me the location of the file in which edits are to be made
Hi @sagangwee, thanks for proposing this as a good first issue. I am removing the label for now and looping in @DubeySandeep to approve the label. It will be added back if approved. Thanks!
For new contributors: See https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributor-dashboard for getting started with the contributor dashboard.

Hello! I'm eager to contribute to this issue and make a meaningful impact. Could you please provide guidance on how I can get involved in this GitHub open-source project? I'm enthusiastic and ready to contribute!
Hello  i am new to open source. And i want contribute in open source. I want to try to solve this issue. Can you please guide & help to solve this issue??

Hii @sagangwee cannot Review Translations Tab on my side on local environment or on the oppia.org need help regarding this
![creatoorDashboard](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/53387208/e6e36c2d-483d-4e37-b889-f8e83f76e405)

Hello @seanlip  the issue is related to CSS. So, I have made changes.



![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/c11869b8-8103-453d-8074-183cc2f26054)



![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/d59a69f3-4057-4bea-a237-06b6c8c0c17d)

Is this the change we were looking for?

@diya-bhatia  The UI seems reasonable, but you should confirm that the CSS classes aren't used anywhere else and that the changes you propose do not affect other pages/tabs in the contributor dashboard. Can you confirm that?

Thanks @diya-bhatia looks good to me as well

Assigning issue to you. Before making a PR please make sure that this change doesn't cause any breakages(overlapping of UI elements) in Contributor Dashboard.
Hi @diya-bhatia, any updates on this ?
@Ash-2k3  I will be making a PR by this weekend sorry for delay.
@diya-bhatia Any updates on this?
@sagangwee Hello there, I would like to be assigned to this issue. Thanks!

@rickycheah Per the guidance at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue, please provide an explanation of what your PR will do (with names of files you're changing, what you plan to change in each file, etc.). If it looks good, we can assign you to this issue.

Please also follow the other instructions on that wiki page if you have not yet done so. Thanks!

Hey @sagangwee, as discussed above, this issue can be resolved by removing extra padding below the 'Translations Review Language Selector'. To solve this issue, I have modified ```core/templates/pages/contributor-dashboard-page/contributions-and-review/contributions-and-review.component.html``` by removing the padding declarations in the ```.oppia-contributions-tab-panel``` and the ```oppia-contributions-tab-panel-container``` classes. This is what the UI looks like after making the mentioned changes: Since these classes are not used anywhere else in the file, no other pages/tabs should be affected to my knowledge. Please let me know if I should make any other changes, thanks!
@aroch17, this looks good to me, just one concern since you are removing the padding, can you check if it's not breaking UI for other tabs, "Submit Question", "Translate Text", etc.
Hey @Ash-2k3, this is what the 'Submit Question' and 'Translate Text' tabs look like: I believe this change does not affect these tabs. Let me know if this works, thanks!
Thanks @aroch17, looks fine to me. Happy to assign you this issue.
Thanks @Ash-2k3, I'll open a PR by tomorrow. Happy to help.

Hey @Ash-2k3, a quick question. I have made the required changes to the file but when I run ```git status```, this is the output: And the output for ```git diff index.yaml``` is: I have not modified the ```index.yaml``` file at all (I suppose it's autogenerated?). Should I still stage all the changes using ```git add .``` or not include the ```index.yaml``` file in my commit? Let me know, thanks!
I think for now it's safe to restore index.yaml and not include it in commit.
Alright understood, thanks a lot!

> There's a lot of extra whitespace below the language selector:
> 
> ![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9004726/225400348-0bb6db00-0eca-4a19-815d-5f324a066d13.png)
> 
> For new contributors, you'll want to look at the elements in core/templates/pages/contributor-dashboard-page/contributions-and-review/contributions-and-review.component.html. See https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributor-dashboard to get star

Please assign this task to me.

Hey @Ash-2k3, I opened a PR for this issue a few days back but have received no feedback on it. Could you PTAL? Thanks!
Link: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/18826

I am removing the label for now and looping in @DubeySandeep to approve the label. It will be added back if approved. Thanks! For new contributors: See https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributor-dashboard for getting started with the contributor dashboard. Hello! I'm eager to contribute to this issue and make a meaningful impact. Could you please provide guidance on how I can get involved in this GitHub open-source project? I'm enthusiastic and ready to contribute! Hello i am new to open source. And i want contribute in open source. I want to try to solve this issue. Can you please guide & help to solve this issue?? Hii @sagangwee cannot Review Translations Tab on my side on local environment or on the oppia.org need help regarding this ![creatoorDashboard](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/53387208/e6e36c2d-483d-4e37-b889-f8e83f76e405) @ShreySinha02 For an account to be able to review translations, it must first have the rights to do so in a certain language. Assigning the permissions to an account is done by an account with a "Translation Admin" role. To add that role to the admin account (on your local dev environment), go to Admin Page, then under the Roles tab, type in the account username, click the pencil icon, and finally add a new role. To assign the review translation rights to an account, go to `/contributor-dashboard-admin` page and under the heading "Add contributor rights", type in the account username, select REVIEW_TRANSLATIONS rights and choose a language that the account can review translations in. Next, you must have translation data to represent the translations to work with. Follow the instructions [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributor-dashboard#local-development). If running the script doesn't work, see the google doc linked in that section that gives instructions for populating translation opportunities. Hello @seanlip the issue is related to CSS. So, I have made changes. ![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/c11869b8-8103-453d-8074-183cc2f26054) ![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/d59a69f3-4057-4bea-a237-06b6c8c0c17d) Is this the change we were looking for? @diya-bhatia The UI seems reasonable, but you should confirm that the CSS classes aren't used anywhere else and that the changes you propose do not affect other pages/tabs in the contributor dashboard. Can you confirm that? Thanks @diya-bhatia looks good to me as well Assigning issue to you. Before making a PR please make sure that this change doesn't cause any breakages(overlapping of UI elements) in Contributor Dashboard. ![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/35dd3a58-b0ef-42e2-a2f4-3d140e5ace19) ![Image](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/113203202/818d1cd7-33de-4bb8-9897-6da17c9190da) @seanlip This change does not affect any other pages/tabs in the contributor dashboard. questions_generated: What is the main issue highlighted in the oppia_oppia repository's bug report?
Which file should new contributors focus on to address the whitespace issue in the oppia_oppia repository?
What is a suggested approach to resolve the whitespace issue mentioned in the bug report?
How can a new contributor get started with the oppia_oppia repository's contributor dashboard?
What role must an account have to review translations in the oppia_oppia repository?
How can translation review rights be assigned to an account in the oppia_oppia repository?
What is the purpose of the 'oppia-contributions-dropdown-list-option' elements in the HTML code?
What CSS property is mentioned as a potential fix for the whitespace issue?
golden_answers_generated: The main issue is the presence of extraneous whitespace below the translation review language selector on the contributor dashboard page.
New contributors should focus on the file located at core/templates/pages/contributor-dashboard-page/contributions-and-review/contributions-and-review.component.html.
One suggested approach to resolve the issue is to adjust the margin or padding properties using CSS, or to modify the position properties of the elements causing the whitespace.
New contributors can get started by visiting the Contributor Dashboard on the Oppia Wiki, which provides guidance and resources for contributing to the repository.
An account must have a 'Translation Admin' role and review translation rights in a specific language to review translations.

Translation review rights can be assigned by going to the /contributor-dashboard-admin page and under the 'Add contributor rights' section, entering the account username, selecting REVIEW_TRANSLATIONS rights, and choosing a language.
The 'oppia-contributions-dropdown-list-option' elements represent the different options available in the dropdown menu for selecting review or contribution tasks.
The margin or padding CSS properties are mentioned as potential fixes for the extraneous whitespace issue.
